{{pp-pc1}} {{about||the newspaper comic|Chuckle Bros (comics)}} {{Use British English|date=June 2013}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2018}} {{Infobox comedian | name = Chuckle Brothers | image = Alice 2008 and Chuckle Brothers 028.jpg | caption = Barry (left) and Paul (right) in 2008 | birth_date = '''Barry David Elliott'''
{{Birth date|1944|12|24|df=y}}
'''Paul Harman Elliott'''
{{Birth date and age|1947|10|18|df=y}} | birth_place = {{Nowrap|[[Rotherham]], [[West Riding of Yorkshire]],}}
England |death_date= '''Barry David Elliott'''
{{death date and age|2018|8|5|1944|12|24|df=yes}} | medium = Television and stage | genre = [[Slapstick]] and [[parody]] | notable_work = ''ChuckleHounds'' (1985–86)
''[[ChuckleVision]]'' (1987–2009)
''[[To Me... To You...]]'' (1996–98)
''[[Chuckle Time]]'' (2018) | active = 1967–2018 }} The '''Chuckle Brothers''' were an English children's comedy [[double act]] comprising '''Barry David Elliott''' (24 December 1944 – 5 August 2018) and '''Paul Harman Elliott''' (born 18 October 1947).{{Cite web|title = Mr Barry David Elliott director information. Free director information|url = https://companycheck.co.uk/director/902591247/MR-BARRY-DAVID-ELLIOTT|website = Company Check|accessdate = 16 October 2015}}{{Cite web|title = Mr Paul Harman Elliott director information. Free director information|url = https://companycheck.co.uk/director/904638926/MR-PAUL-HARMAN-ELLIOTT/summary|website = Company Check|accessdate = 18 October 2016}} They were known for their [[BBC]] children's programme ''[[ChuckleVision]]'', which celebrated its twenty-first series with a 2010 stage tour entitled ''An Audience with the Chuckle Brothers''. The comedy of the Chuckle Brothers usually derived from [[slapstick]], [[wordplay]] and other [[visual gag]]s, and their [[catchphrases]] included "To me, to you" and "Oh dear, oh dear". ==Early life== The brothers were born in [[Rotherham]] to Amy and James Patton Elliott, in 1944 and 1947. Their father was a [[Gang Show]] performer whose stage name was Gene Patton; he worked with the 18-year-old [[Peter Sellers]] in 1943 in The No. 10 Gang and gave performances in [[London]], [[Orkney]] and the [[Hebrides]], [[Iceland]], the Far East, India, and [[Burma]]. Their two older brothers, Jimmy and Brian, are known professionally as the [[Patton Brothers]] and have appeared in ''[[ChuckleVision]]'', Jimmy as the nameless character known colloquially as "No Slacking", and Brian as another unnamed character known as "Getoutofit".{{cite news | last = Harman | first = Len | title = A Showbiz Dynasty | work = | publisher = ''[[The Stage]]'' | date = 7 December 1981 | url = http://www.thestage.co.uk/archive | accessdate = 12 February 2009}} ==Career== ===Television=== The Chuckle Brothers won the television [[talent show]] ''[[Opportunity Knocks (UK TV series)|Opportunity Knocks]]'' in 1967, followed by success on ''[[New Faces]]'' in 1974.{{cite news | last = | first = | title = Preview: The Chuckle Brothers at the Apollo, Oxford – April 19 | work = | publisher = ''[[The Oxford Times]]'' | date = 18 April 2001 | url = http://www.oxfordtimes.co.uk/archive/2001/04/18/Oxfordshire+Archive/6618858.Preview__The_Chuckle_Brothers_at_the_Apollo__Oxford___April_19/ | accessdate = 18 April 2011}} In the late 1970s and early 1980s, the two brothers began their television careers as a double act, making their debut in April 1979 on the BBC comedy series ''Lennie and Jerry'', hosted by [[Lennie Bennett]] and Jerry Stevens.{{Cite web|url=http://collections-search.bfi.org.uk/web/Details/ChoiceFilmWorks/150595693|title=Collections Search {{!}} BFI {{!}} British Film Institute|website=collections-search.bfi.org.uk|accessdate=28 March 2016}} They made two appearances on the game show ''[[3-2-1]]'', hosted by [[Ted Rogers (comedian)|Ted Rogers]], in January 1980 and April 1982,{{Cite web|url=http://collections-search.bfi.org.uk/web/Details/ChoiceFilmWorks/150590643|title=Collections Search {{!}} BFI {{!}} British Film Institute|website=collections-search.bfi.org.uk|accessdate=28 March 2016}}{{Cite web|url=http://collections-search.bfi.org.uk/web/Details/ChoiceFilmWorks/150570899|title=Collections Search {{!}} BFI {{!}} British Film Institute|website=collections-search.bfi.org.uk|accessdate=28 March 2016}} and appeared on the long-running BBC programme, ''[[The Good Old Days (UK TV series)|The Good Old Days]]'', in June 1980.{{Cite web|url=http://collections-search.bfi.org.uk/web/Details/ChoiceFilmWorks/150615311|title=Collections Search {{!}} BFI {{!}} British Film Institute|website=collections-search.bfi.org.uk|accessdate=4 July 2017}} In August 1983, the Brothers appeared on ''[[The Freddie Starr Showcase]]'' alongside the comedian [[Freddie Starr]].{{cite news|title=The Freddie Starr Showcase|url=http://genome.ch.bbc.co.uk/0126f80f6cc4409bb8cbf22b280c71c4|accessdate=29 September 2017|work=The Radio Times|date=28 July 1983|pages=39}} Their primary work was mainly focused on children's television, beginning initially on Christmas Day in 1980 with them taking part in a televised children's show, ''A Merry Morning'', in which the brothers entertained around 250 children from the Leeds area in [[Yeadon Town Hall]].{{Cite web|url=http://collections-search.bfi.org.uk/web/Details/ChoiceFilmWorks/150233180|title=Collections Search {{!}} BFI {{!}} British Film Institute|website=collections-search.bfi.org.uk|accessdate=28 March 2016}} In 1985, the brothers launched a pre-school programme on the BBC entitled ''Chuckle Hounds'', in which they performed routines with no [[dialogue]], while dressed up in giant dog costumes. Their success in children's television came in 1987, with the launch of their iconic children's show, ''[[ChuckleVision]]'', in which their real-life siblings [[Patton Brothers|Jimmy and Brian Patton]] made occasional appearances.{{Cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/comedy/features/the-chuckle-brothers-life-after-television-9107691.html|title=The Chuckle Brothers: Life after television for Barry and Paul Elliott|date=5 February 2014|work=The Independent|accessdate=24 June 2017}} The show proved a ratings hit with children, running for twenty-one series over a period of twenty-two years, and giving them a Special Award for Lifetime Achievement at the [[British Academy Children's Awards]] in 2008.{{Cite web|url=http://awards.bafta.org/award/2008/childrens/bafta-kids-vote|title=2008 Children's BAFTA Kids' Vote {{!}} BAFTA Awards|website=awards.bafta.org|accessdate=24 June 2017}} The final series of the programme was aired in December 2009. The two contributed further to children's entertainment, performing at the ''Children's Royal Variety Performance'' in May 1992,{{cite news|title=Children's Royal Variety Performance|url=http://genome.ch.bbc.co.uk/9a9d93694cce4f9c82c71fa9ea54604c|accessdate=29 September 2017|work=The Radio Times|date=21 May 1992|pages=78}} and launching a children's [[game show]] titled ''[[To Me... To You...|To Me, To You!]]'', which ran between 1996 and 1998 and which took its name from their signature [[catchphrase]]. Outside of children's entertainment, the brothers have made appearances in many other television series, both together and separately. In May 2008, the they appeared in the [[BBC]] documentary series ''[[Comedy Map of Britain]]'',{{Cite web|url=http://www.southyorkshiretimes.co.uk/whats-on/chuckle-brothers-bring-theatre-to-the-bbc-1-613778|title=Chuckle Brothers bring theatre to the BBC|work=South Yorkshire Times|accessdate=24 June 2017}} and won the 2010 series of ''[[Coach Trip#Celebrity Coach Trip|Celebrity Coach Trip]]''.{{cite web |url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/tv/s136/coach-trip/news/a277261/celebrity-coach-trip-lineup-revealed.html |title=Celebrity 'Coach Trip' lineup revealed |first=Alex |last=Fletcher |date=16 September 2010 |work=[[Digital Spy]]}} In November 2011, the brothers starred in a series of TV advertisements for the UK-based van insurance comparison website ''Van Compare.com''{{cite web |url=http://www.vancompare.com/chuckles/chuckle-brothers-help-make-cheap-van-insurance-a-wheeze |title=Chuckle Brothers Help Make Cheap Van Insurance a Wheeze! |date= |publisher=[[Van Compare]] |accessdate=7 November 2011 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120129051535/http://www.vancompare.com/chuckles/chuckle-brothers-help-make-cheap-van-insurance-a-wheeze |archive-date=29 January 2012 |dead-url=yes }} In October 2012, they appeared on ''[[Comedy World Cup]]'' on ''[[Channel 4]]'', while on 15 March 2013, they were featured in [[David Walliams]]' sketch for ''[[Comic Relief]].''{{Cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2294190/Comic-Relief-2013-David-Walliams-confronts-celebrities-s-intimate-with.html|title=David Walliams confronts celebrities he's been 'intimate' with including an abtastic Gwyneth Paltrow and leather-clad Kate Moss in hilarious skit for Comic Relief|work=Mail Online|accessdate=24 June 2017}} From 2013 to 2014, Barry made a number of appearances in the BBC comedy series ''[[Still Open All Hours]]'' as dog owner Mr Marshall, first appearing in the role for the 2013 Christmas special.{{Cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/tv/reviews/still-open-all-hours-review-it-was-a-w-w-worthy-effort-but-there-s-only-one-arkwright-9026351.html|title=Still Open All Hours review: It was a w-w-worthy effort – but|date=26 December 2013|work=The Independent|accessdate=24 June 2017}} On 13 March 2015, they appeared again on Comic Relief, this time in a sketch based around ''National Treasures''. The duo appeared at the 2016 ''[[Royal Variety Performance]]'', performing sketches with host [[David Walliams]]. In April 2018, it was announced the brothers were in the process of recording a new clip show for [[Channel 5 (UK)|Channel 5]], entitled ''[[Chuckle Time]]'';{{Cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-43907917|title=BBC|last=|first=|date=|website=|access-date=}} It ran for one series during the summer of that year, although it was cut short following the death of Barry Elliot in August 2018. ===Stage=== [[File:Chuckle Brothers - 29 August 2013.jpg|thumb|Paul and Barry Elliott, aka The Chuckle Brothers, on stage at the [[Futurist Theatre]] in Scarborough in 2013]] As well as regular TV appearances, Paul and Barry appeared on stage in venues across the UK. Their annual nationwide tours often included them performing with [[The Patton Brothers]], magic duo ''Safire'', ''The Magic Light Puppet Company'' as well a full cast. Their comedy and [[parody]] shows have included ''The Blackpool Tower Circus'' (1974, 1987), ''To You To Me'' (1995), ''The Chuckle Brothers in Trouble'' (1996), ''The Chuckle Brothers Summer Roadshow'' (1997), ''The Adventures of The Chuckle Brothers'' (1998), ''The Chuckle Brothers Trouble At Sea'' (1999), ''The New Adventures of The Chuckle Brothers'' (2000), ''Spooky Goings On'' (2001), ''Raiders of the Lost Bark'' (2002), ''Star Doors - The Chuckle Brothers Strike Back'' (2003), ''Barry Potty and his Smarter Brother Paul in The Chamber of Horrors'' (2004), ''Pirates of the River Rother'' (2005), ''Doctor What and the Return of the Garlics'' (2006), ''Spooky Goings on 2'' (2007), ''Aladdin'' (Christmas 2007), ''Indiana Chuckles and the Kingdom of the Mythical Sulk'' (2008), ''Chuckle Trek - The Lost Generation'' (2009), ''A Christmas Chuckle'' (Christmas 2009), ''An Audience With....The Chuckle Brothers'' (2010), ''The Twelve Days of Christmas'' (Christmas 2010), ''Barry Potty and his Full Blood Brother Paul in the Ghostly Shadows'' (2011), ''The Return of the Pirates of the River Rother 2: In Strangers Tights'' (2012), ''The Chuckle Brothers meet the Phantom at the Theatre'' (2013), ''A 2014 Space Oddity'' (2014) and ''The Chuckles of Oz'' (2015). Live recordings of ''Pirates of the River Rother'' and ''Spooky Goings On 2'' were released on DVD 2007, the latter under the title ''The Chuckle Brothers – Spooky Goings On Live!'' A box set of the two was also made available. A dress rehearsal of the duo's 1996 tour ''The Chuckle Brothers in Trouble'' was released on DVD in 2008. In addition, the brothers' 2008 tour, ''Indiana Chuckles and The Kingdom of the Mythical Sulk'', set in [[Ancient Egypt]], was released on DVD later that year. The brothers toured theatres annually with their shows until 2015. Although, they performed regularly in pantomimes, festivals, events and holiday parks until Barry's death in 2018. During their career, Paul and Barry performed in fifty one pantomimes together. Their first was ''Babes in the Wood'', which they performed as ''The Harman Brothers'' in Malvern from 1967 until 1968 with [[Sandy Powell (comedian)|Sandy Powell]]. Their final pantomime became ''Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs'' at The Mayflower Theatre in Southampton, which they appeared in from 2017 until 2018 with [[Craig Revel Horwood]]. They were awarded a ''Great British Pantomime Award'' for Best Double Act for this production. Since Barry's death, Paul has stated his intention to continue to appear in pantomime productions. ===Other appearances=== From 2014 until 2018, the brothers made appearances at various nightclubs and student events, performing sets and posing for photographs. After Barry's death, Paul stated that he would continue with these appearances.{{Cite news|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/whats-on/music-nightlife-news/chuckle-brothers-level-nightclub-liverpool-12634294|title=The Chuckle Brothers are appearing at a Liverpool nightclub|last=McLoughlin|first=Jamie|date=21 February 2017|work=Liverpool Echo|accessdate=22 June 2017}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.gazettelive.co.uk/whats-on/whats-on-news/chuckle-brothers-coming-teesside-nightclub-12766967|title=The Chuckle Brothers are coming to Teesside for a meet and greet|last=Love|first=Laura|date=20 March 2017|work=gazettelive|accessdate=22 June 2017}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.coventrytelegraph.net/whats-on/music-nightlife-news/chuckle-brothers-coming-coventry-nightclub-12145274|title=The Chuckle Brothers are coming to a Coventry nightclub|last=Rodger|first=James|date=9 November 2016|work=Coventry Telegraph|accessdate=22 June 2017}} In March 2016, the brothers appeared in a promotional video for the game [[Hitman (2016 video game)|Hitman]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2016/03/11/watch-the-chuckle-brothers-play-real-life-hitman|title=Watch the Chuckle Brothers Play Real-Life Hitman|last=Skrebels|first=Joe|date=11 March 2016|website=IGN|accessdate=24 June 2017}} ===Music=== In October 1995, the Chuckle Brothers released an album entitled ''To You to Me'' featuring eleven tracks.{{Cite web|title = The Chuckle Brothers – To You To Me|url = http://www.discogs.com/Chuckle-Brothers-To-You-To-Me/release/7167206|website = Discogs|accessdate = 9 October 2015}} Many of the tracks were based on their catchphrases, such as "To me, to you" and "Silly You, Silly Me". In October 2014, the Chuckle Brothers collaborated with [[Tinchy Stryder]] to release a charity single "[[To Me, To You (Bruv)]]" to raise funds for the [[African-Caribbean Leukaemia Trust]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/music/2014/oct/23/tinchy-stryder-duet-chuckle-brothers-african-caribbean-leukaemia-trust|title=Tinchy Stryder’s track with the Chuckle Brothers becomes internet sensation|last=Ellis-Petersen|first=Hannah|date=23 October 2014|newspaper=The Guardian|issn=0261-3077|accessdate=1 October 2016}} In September 2015, the Brothers performed for twenty minutes at the music festival [[Bestival]], citing it as the biggest crowd they had ever performed in front of.{{Cite web|title = Chuckle Brothers had a 'brilliant' time at Bestival and can't wait to do it again!|url = http://tv.bt.com/tv/tv-soap/chuckle-brothers-had-a-brilliant-time-at-bestival-and-cant-wait-to-do-it-again-11364003592799|website = BT.com|accessdate = 9 October 2015}} ===Mobile game=== In July 2016 the Chuckle Brothers released their first [[mobile app]] for [[Android (operating system)|Android]] and [[iOS]] titled "Chuckle World". It is a [[quiz]] game with [[Tinder (app)|Tinder]] style sliding mechanics and endless style mobile gameplay.{{cite web|url=http://fasnastic.com/chuckleworld/|title=Chuckle Brothers: Chuckle World|website=fasnastic.com|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160730121952/http://fasnastic.com/chuckleworld/|archivedate=30 July 2016}} ==Critical reception== In November 2005, [[Jacques Peretti]], a reporter for ''[[The Guardian]]'', remarked on how "the appeal of the Chuckle Brothers remains a mystery to anyone over eight, but to anyone under eight, they're the ultimate entertainment experience". "The little people think they're hilarious, and if you add up all the little people across the country who think they're hilarious, you'd think it's ''ChuckleVision'' that should have the 28 comedy gongs, not ''Little Britain'' or ''The Office''."{{cite news|title = Jacques Peretti: Down with the Kids|url = https://www.theguardian.com/media/2005/nov/26/tvandradio.theguide|newspaper= The Guardian|accessdate = 10 October 2015}} On 31 January 2007, [[Rotherham United F.C.|Rotherham United]] chairman Denis Coleman announced that the brothers had both been made honorary presidents of the football club.{{cite web |last= |first= |title=Millers Make Two Big Signings |publisher=The Chuckle Brothers Official UK Website |date=7 February 2007 |url=http://www.thechucklebrothersontour.co.uk/news/index.html#7-2-2007 |accessdate=4 September 2007 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070823192859/http://www.thechucklebrothersontour.co.uk/news/index.html#7-2-2007 |archivedate=23 August 2007 |deadurl=yes }} In 2008, they were honoured with the Special Award at the [[British Academy Children's Awards]].{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/7758184.stm|title=Bafta honour for Chuckle Brothers|date=1 December 2008|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=26 January 2010}}{{Cite web|url=http://awards.bafta.org/award/2008/childrens/special-award|title=2008 Children's Special Award {{!}} BAFTA Awards|website=awards.bafta.org|accessdate=24 June 2017}} ==Personal life== The brothers regularly appeared at events and openings, an example being the unveiling of the Tropical Butterfly House, Wildlife and Falconry Centre in [[North Anston]] in July 2013, which Barry attended.{{Cite news|url=http://www.itv.com/news/calendar/2013-07-06/chuckle-brother-to-open-tropical-butterfly-house/|title=Chuckle brother to open tropical butterfly house|work=ITV News|accessdate=7 July 2017}} Supporters of [[Rotherham United F.C.|Rotherham United Football Club]],{{cite web|url=http://www.football-league.co.uk/features/20081127/famous-fans-the-chuckle-brothers_2293307_1467862|title=Famous Fans: The Chuckle Brothers|date=27 November 2008|publisher=The Football League|accessdate=18 April 2011|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120929121714/http://www.football-league.co.uk/features/20081127/famous-fans-the-chuckle-brothers_2293307_1467862|archivedate=29 September 2012}} they were made Honorary Life Presidents of the club in 2007.{{cite web|url=https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/news/uk-news/barry-chuckle-dead-live-tributes-14992072|title=Entertainer Barry Chuckle has died at the age of 73 – latest tributes|work=Manchester Evening News|date=5 August 2018|access-date=5 August 2018}} Both brothers were married – Barry was married to Ann and Paul is married to Sue.{{Cite web|title = Whatever Happened To... The Chuckle Brothers?|url = http://www.nowmagazine.co.uk/celebrity-news/whatever-happened-to-the-chuckle-brothers-315567|work= Now Magazine|accessdate = 25 October 2015}} Both brothers seem to have been [[Smoking|smokers]], although Paul had apparently stopped the habit by 2000.{{Cite web|url=https://twitter.com/PaulChuckle2/status/586481580937519104|title="@ZacharyCocker: @PaulChuckle2 Do you still smoke Paul? #hopeyoustopped " that was 28 yrs ago stopped 15 yrs ago 👍|last=Chuckle|first=Paul|date=|website=Twitter|archive-url=https://archive.is/20170718211535/https://twitter.com/PaulChuckle2/status/586481580937519104|archivedate=18 July 2017|dead-url=yes|accessdate=28 October 2015}} Paul lives in {{not a typo|Serlby}}, [[Doncaster]], whilst his brother Barry lived in [[Ravenfield]], [[Rotherham]], before his death. In April 2007, whilst on holiday on the Greek island of [[Cephalonia]], Paul broke his nose and suffered cuts and bruises when he lost control of his motorcycle after suddenly braking to avoid a goatherd and herd. Instead of helping him, tourists who stopped at the accident shouted the Chuckle Brothers' catchphrase, "To me, to you."{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/cbbcnews/hi/newsid_6600000/newsid_6601300/6601395.stm|title=Chuckle brother hurt in crash|date=27 April 2007 |publisher=BBC|work=CBBC Newsround|accessdate=31 March 2010}} An [[urban legend]] surrounding Barry Chuckle's supposed death from a heart attack has circulated since at least 2008. In 2010, the brothers issued a statement on their website stating that the story was "complete and utter rubbish".{{cite web|url=http://www.thechucklebrothersontour.co.uk/news/index.html |title=News On Barry |year=2010 |publisher=The Chuckle Brothers |accessdate=14 April 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100305072045/http://www.thechucklebrothersontour.co.uk/news/index.html |archivedate=5 March 2010 }} The BBC reported that the death hoaxes had upset young viewers, and had shocked Barry when they re-surfaced. The hoax was said to have initially spread via [[Facebook]] in 2008, but re-surfaced in 2010 via [[Twitter]].{{cite news|title=Barry Chuckle's shock over death rumours|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/south_yorkshire/10268581.stm|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=8 June 2010 | date=8 June 2010}} In December 2015, Paul was caught [[speeding]] in a 40 mph zone. As a result of his actions he chose to undertake a [[National Driver Offender Retraining Scheme|speed awareness course]], as opposed to accepting three [[Point system (driving)|penalty points]] and a fine. He reportedly stated at the time that he was "a careful driver" who had previously never "been done" in the fifty years that he had been driving.{{Cite news|url=http://www.southyorkshiretimes.co.uk/news/silly-me-moment-for-chuckle-brother-caught-speeding-in-south-yorkshire-1-7633190|title=‘Silly me’ moment for Chuckle Brother caught speeding in South Yorkshire|work=South Yorkshire Times|accessdate=10 July 2017}}{{Cite news|url=https://uk.news.yahoo.com/chuckle-brother-paul-elliott-is-caught-speeding-154407026.html|title=Chuckle Brother Paul Elliott Is Caught Speeding|accessdate=10 July 2017}} ===Controversy=== In December 2010, Barry announced his support for a proposal that one of the [[Cameron–Clegg coalition|Conservative–Liberal Democrat coalition]] government's planned [[Free school (England)|free schools]], a taxpayer-funded school independent of the local authority, should be established in Rotherham.{{cite web|url=http://www.rotherhamadvertiser.co.uk/news/88038/free-school-a-brilliant-idea-says-barry-chuckle.aspx|title=Free school "a brilliant idea" says Barry Chuckle|date=7 December 2010|work=The Rotherham Advertiser|accessdate=19 February 2012}} In January 2011, it was announced that Barry had planned to incorporate a 100-pupil free school named ''Rotherham Central Free School'' in his hometown of Rotherham. His son's partner was to serve as the head teacher of the school.{{Cite web|title = Barry Chuckle to set up Rotherham school|url = http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/showbiz/news/a301287/barry-chuckle-to-set-up-rotherham-school.html|work= Digital Spy|accessdate = 9 October 2015}} By February 2012, no premises, staff or pupils for the school had been confirmed, despite announcing an intention on opening in September of that year.{{Cite web|title = Exclusive: Mystery of a Chuckle Brother’s ‘ghost’ school with no staff or pupils|url = http://www.yorkshirepost.co.uk/news/main-topics/education/exclusive-mystery-of-a-chuckle-brother-s-ghost-school-with-no-staff-or-pupils-1-4220165|work= Yorkshire Post|accessdate = 9 October 2015}} In February 2014, the Chuckle Brothers attended the trial of [[Dave Lee Travis]]. Paul stated that it was a "complete shock" that such an attack had occurred in their presence.{{Cite web|title = Chuckle Brothers' 'shock' at Dave Lee Travis sex assault claims|url = https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2014/sep/12/chuckle-brothers-dave-lee-travis-trial|work= The Guardian|accessdate = 9 October 2015|first = Press|last = Association}} After giving evidence, the Brothers posed for a [[selfie]] outside [[Southwark Crown Court]] with Paul tweeting it{{Cite web|title = ITV News on Twitter|url = https://twitter.com/itvnews/status/510435558414221312|website = Twitter|accessdate = 31 October 2015}} to thousands of followers on his Twitter account.{{Cite web|title = Chuckle Brothers take selfie outside DLT court|url = http://www.itv.com/news/update/2014-09-12/chuckle-brothers-take-selfie-outside-dlt-court/|website = ITV News|accessdate = 31 October 2015}} The Brothers had smiled whilst taking the photograph, and later some deemed their actions as inappropriate.{{Cite web|title = Is this the most inappropriate selfie of all time?|url = http://i100.independent.co.uk/article/is-this-the-most-inappropriate-selfie-of-all-time--g1i720kdVg|website = i100|accessdate = 31 October 2015}} In March 2016, Barry received condemnation for sharing a [[Facebook]] post from the [[Far-right politics|far right-wing]] political party [[Britain First]]. The post, originally shared in June 2015, called on politicians to strip migrants of their citizenship if they left the country to join a terror group. Following the unearthing of the post, [[Tommy Robinson (activist)|Tommy Robinson]], former leader of the [[English Defence League]] (EDL) came to Barry's defence, calling on people to "leave the man alone".{{Cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/britain-first-meme-shared-by-chuckle-brother-barry-elliott-sparks-fury_uk_56f01a2fe4b0cc1ede8c7082|title=Chuckle Brother Barry's Britain First Controversy Defended By Tommy Robinson|work=The Huffington Post|accessdate=28 March 2016}} Britain First subsequently described the incident as a "non-story".{{Cite web|url=https://www.britainfirst.tv/chuckle-brothers-star-outed-as-britain-first-supporter/|title=Chuckle Brothers star "outed" as Britain First supporter|last=|first=|date=21 March 2016|website=Britain First|archive-url=https://archive.is/20170624190251/https://www.britainfirst.tv/chuckle-brothers-star-outed-as-britain-first-supporter/|archivedate=24 June 2017|dead-url=yes|accessdate=24 June 2017}} === Barry's death=== On 5 August 2018, Barry died after a period of ill health.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-45074955 |title=Entertainer Barry Chuckle dies at 73 |publisher=BBC News |date=5 August 2018 |accessdate=5 August 2018 |quote=It is with great sadness that the family announce that Barry passed away peacefully at his home surrounded by his wife Ann and all his family.}}{{cite news |last1=Dixon |first1=Stephen |title=Barry Chuckle obituary |url=https://www.theguardian.com/tv-and-radio/2018/aug/05/barry-chuckle-obituary |accessdate=6 August 2018 |work=The Guardian |date=5 August 2018}} Paul grieved Barry's death stating "I've not just lost my brother, I've lost my theatrical partner of many, many years and my very best friend."{{Cite news|url=https://news.sky.com/story/barry-chuckle-of-the-chuckle-brothers-dies-aged-73-manager-says-11461833|title=Barry Chuckle of the Chuckle Brothers duo dies aged 73|work=Sky News|access-date=7 August 2018|language=en-GB}} Paul later revealed that his brother had been diagnosed with [[bone cancer]], but had kept it secret from his manager, fans and Paul himself as he had wanted to perform for as long as possible.{{cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/barry-chuckle-dead-brothers-cause-bone-cancer-paul-chucklevision-a8480416.html|title=Barry Chuckle kept illness secret from fans before he died, brother claims|publisher=|accessdate=14 August 2018}}{{cite web|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/showbiz/celebrity-news/barry-chuckle-diagnosed-with-bone-cancer-before-death-aged-73-brother-says-a3905111.html|title=Barry Chuckle was fighting bone cancer before his death, brother says|publisher=Standard|accessdate=14 August 2018}} His funeral was held on 17 August at the [[Rotherham United]] stadium and was attended by a number of show business friends; a large number of fans waited outside to pay their respects.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-south-yorkshire-45219285 |title=Chuckle Brothers star Barry's funeral held in Rotherham|author=|date=17 August 2018|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=17 August 2018}} ==References== {{Reflist|2}} ==External links== * {{IMDb name|1035216|Paul Elliott}} * {{IMDb name|1028657|Barry {{Refimprove|date=September 2016}}
An '''each-way''' [[gambling|bet]] is a wager offered by [[bookmaker]]s consisting of two separate bets: a win bet and a place bet. For the win part of the bet to give a return, the selection must win, or finish first, in the event. For the place part of the bet to give a return, the selection must either win or finish in one of the predetermined places for the event, such as first place or second place. The odds paid on the place part of the bet are usually a fraction (commonly {{frac|1|2}}, {{frac|1|3}}, {{frac|1|4}} or {{frac|1|5}}) of the win odds. The trade-off being that one has a greater chance of making one's bet in trade for getting less payoff for doing so. Examples are domestic football knockout competitions (e.g. [[FA Cup]]) where the quoted place terms may be {{frac|1|2}}.
In horse racing in the United Kingdom, the "place" is set strictly by the [[Jockey Club]] and will depend on the size of the field (that is, how many horses are running) so that the "place" may be just 1st and 2nd, 1st 2nd and 3rd, or even 1st 2nd 3rd or 4th on a big race like the [[Grand National]], and may pay {{frac|1|4}} or {{frac|1|5}} the odds.
== Staking == Because an each-way wager comprises two bets, the total staked is twice the unit stake. For example, a £5 each-way [[Glossary of bets offered by UK bookmakers|single]] would cost £10, as would a £5 each-way [[Glossary of bets offered by UK bookmakers|treble]] comprising as it does a £5 win treble and a £5 place treble.
==Settling the bets== Calculation of returns uses either decimal odds or (fractional odds + 1).
===Example 1=== £50 each-way on a football team 'to win the cup' at 15-2 and {{frac|1|3}} the odds a place 1 or 2 would cost £100. *Returns for the win part of the bet would be (£50 × 7.5) + stake = £425 *Returns for the place part of the bet would be (£50 × 2.5) + stake = £175 *If the team 'won the cup' the total returns would be £425 + £175 = £600 and if the team was beaten in the final the returns would be £175. If the team did not reach the final the wager would be lost.
===Example 2=== A £10 each-way single on a 10-1 selection in a horse race and paying {{frac|1|4}} the odds a place 1, 2, or 3 would cost £20. * Returns on the win part of the bet would be £10 × (10/1 × 1) + stake = £110 * Returns on the place part of the bet would be £10 × (10/4 × 1) + stake = £35 * Total returns would be £110 + £35 = £145 if the horse won the race, but just £35 if the horse only finished second or third.
== Horse Racing Place Terms == The number horses and the type of race generally determines the number of places paid out and the fraction of the win odds used for settling the place part of an each way bet.<ref>https://support.paddypower.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/381/~/horse-racing-place-terms</ref>
{| class="wikitable" |- ! Race Type/Runners ! Odds ! Places |- | [[Handicap (horse racing)|Handicaps]] of more than 15 runners | 1/4 | 4 |- | [[Handicap (horse racing)|Handicaps]] of 12-15 runners | 1/4 | 3 |- | All other races of more than 7 runners | 1/5 | 3 |- | All races of 5-7 runners | 1/4 | 2 |- | All races of less than 5 runners | - | win only |}
Often for big races or as a special promotion the big bookie's will offer enhanced place terms where they pay an extra place or pay the place part at 1/4 instead of 1/5.
==See also== *[[Mathematics of bookmaking]] *[[Glossary of bets offered by UK bookmakers#Each-Way|Glossary of bets offered by UK bookmakers]] *[[Full cover bet]] *[[Parlay (gambling)|Parlay or Accumulator bet]]
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [http://racingdatabase.com/each-way-betting-handicap-races/ How To Profit From Each Way Betting] Explains how to profit from each-way betting in horse races * [http://www.bettingpro.co.uk/category/Betting-Strategy/Each-Way-betting-201307220001/ Each Way Betting in Football] Explains each-way soccer betting * [http://www.ratz4racing.co.uk/each-way-betting-explained.php Each-Way Betting Explained] A good explanation of how each-way betting works * [http://www.sportinglybetter.com/betting-terms/each-way-betting-explained/ Each Way Betting Explained] A football based explanation of each way betting
[[Category:Wagering]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox person |name = Edward Clug |image= |caption = |birth_date= {{Birth date and age|1973|06|26|df=y}} |birth_place= [[Beiuș]], [[Romania]] |occupation = Choreographer |years_active= }} '''Edward Clug''' (born 1973 in [[Beiuș]], [[Romania]]) is an international renowned [[choreographer]] in the field of [[contemporary ballet]] and a director of Maribor Ballet. Clug studied classical ballet in Cluj-Napoca.<ref name=en-knap>[http://www.en-knap.com/15/488/edward_clug.html/ Edward Clug.] En Knap. Retrieved January 04, 2012.</ref>
==Career== In 1991 Clug joined [[Maribor]]'s [[Slovene National Theatre, Maribor|Slovene National Theater]] (SNT) as a Principal Dancer while also performing with Zagreb Ballet as a guest artist.<ref name=en-knap/>
In 1996, the Slovene National Theater commissioned Clug to choreograph his first ballet called ''Babylon'' by Tomas Pandur. Clug's first full evening ballet, called ''Tango'', premiered at SNT in 1998.<ref>[http://6-primeagency.com/cms/index.php/artists/individual/edward_clug/ Edward Clug - Radio and Juliet Tour.] 6-prime Agency. Retrieved January 05, 2012.</ref>
Continuing his relationship with the Slovene National Theater, in 2003 he was appointed director of Maribor ballet, leading the company towards new and distinctive directions. Throughout the past decade, Clug drew attention of the international audience to himself, due to his specific choreographic style. He equally succeeded in putting the Maribor Ballet ensemble on the international dancing map. The Ballet of the SNG Maribor participated in the largest theatre festivals throughout the world performing his choreographies. His ''Radio & Juliet'', choreographed in 2005 in Maribor, became an international hit and toured internationally: Jacob's Pillow Dance Festival (USA), The Stars of the with nights festival in Mariinski theatre St.Petersburg, Festival of Firsts in Pittsburgh, Arts Festival in Singapore, Biarritz Festival in France, Dance Festival in Tel Aviv, Sintra Festival in Portugal, Festival Des Arts de Saint-Sauveur (Canada), and at the Seoul International Dance Festival (Korea), at the Milan Teatro Piccolo and toured Netherlands, Belgium, Italy, and the countries of ex-Yugoslavia.
In 2006, he created ''Architecture of Silence'', in partnership with the Slovene National Theaters in Maribor and Ljubljana, with two choirs and two orchestras.The performance opened Singapore Arts Festival (2008). In 2008 he starts to collaborate with Slovenian composer Milko Lazar with whom he creates ''Pret-a-porter'' at the SNG Maribor (2008), ''4 Reasons'' for the National Ballet of Portugal (2009) and ''Pocket Concerto'' for Stuttgart Ballet (2009).<ref name=en-knap/><ref name=Ardani>[http://www.ardani.com/kings-opus3-Edward-Clug.php/ Edward Clug.] Ardani Artists. Retrieved January 04, 2012.</ref> After the success of Pocket Concerto he continues to collaborate with Stuttgart Ballet for whom he creates "Ssss..." (2012) and together with Lazar "No Men´s Land" (2014). Both pieces received great response from critics and the audience.
After Stuttgart Ballet, Edward Clug continues to work with other major companies. For the Zurich Ballet he created the acclaimed Hill Harper´s Dream (2013) and Royal Ballet of Flanders commissioned him to stage Stravinsky´s "Les Noces" (2013). His latest creation for the Maribor Ballet is Stravinsky’s Rite of Spring. Maggie Foyer describes his work in Dance Europe magazine: "Edward Clug, director of the Maribor Ballet, has achieved the near impossible: a new and meaningful interpretation of Stravinsky's Le Sacre du Printemps". His works are being performed around the world and were commissioned by many ballet theatres: West Australian Ballet, Romanian National Ballet in Bucharest, Station Zuid in the Netherlands, Bitef Dance Company in Belgrade, Aalto Ballet in Essen, Ukrainian National Ballet in Kiev, Ballet Graz, Croatian National Ballet in Zagreb and Rijeka and Ballet Augsburg. New works are being on the way for Zurich Ballet and NDT2 in 2015.
Edward Clug also collaborated with theatre directors. Beside [[Tomaž Pandur]] with whom he started his choreographic career, he also worked with [[Haris Pašović]] the founder of [[East West Theatre Company]]. Together they created two pieces: [[Europe Today (show)|''Europe Today'']]<ref>[[Ian Shuttleworth|Shuttleworth, Ian]]. (February 23, 2011). [http://www.ft.com/cms/s/2/15936ec0-3f75-11e0-a1ba-00144feabdc0.html#axzz1Eq631acg/ "Europe Today, Slovenian National Theatre, Maribor"] ''Financial Times'' Website. Retrieved January 05, 2012.</ref> and ''[[Roses for Anne Teresa/Football Stories]]''<ref name=mess>[http://mess.ba/2011/en/program/catalogue_entry/183/ MESS Official Website.] Retrieved December 07, 2011.</ref> In ''Europe Today'' he was both choreographer and performer, while in ''[[Roses for Anne Teresa/Football Stories]]'' he was choreographer and coauthor.
==Awards== Edward Clug is the recipient of numerous national and international awards. He has received the Slovene Award of the Prešern Foundation (2005) as well as the Glazer Charter (2008). He is recipient of the Best Contemporary Choreography prize at the 18th International Ballet Competition in Varna; a Bronze Medal at the International Ballet and Choreographic Competition in Moscow, a Bronze Medal at the 4th International Ballet Competition in the Contemporary category in [[Nagoya]] (2002); a Special Prize for Best Choreography at the International Ballet Competition in Nagoya (2002); and third prize and the public award at the 17th Hanover Choreographic Competition in Germany (2003).The show he choreographed, [[Roses for Anne Teresa/Football Stories]], also won a “Special Award for Best Choreography” at the International Theatre Festival MESS Sarajevo 2011.<ref name=mess/> He received in Belgrade Dimitrije Parlić Award for the production of Divine Comedy for Bitef Dance Company in collaboration with Grad Teatar Budva (2011) He was nominated for the Russian awards Golden Mask for the piece Quatro, that was created for the Mariinsky Ballet stars: Denis Matviienko, Leonid Sarafanov, Olesja Novikova and Anastasya Matviienko.
==References== {{Reflist|2}}
==External links== "Radio and Juliet" with Maribor Ballet at Jacob's Pillow Dance Festival: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IvMANGrvJI0 "No Men´s Land" with Stuttgart Ballet: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Tns10IJdPO4 "Hill Harper´s Dream" with Zurich Ballet: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EHnq8qrgNzU "Sacre du printemps" with Maribor Ballet: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i-agaQbRtHo "Ssss..." with Stuttgart Ballet: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hqORzjQPTf8

revision.text:
{{expand language|topic=|langcode=ar|otherarticle=حديقة حيوان الجيزة|date=March 2017}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2013}} {{Infobox zoo |zoo_name = Giza Zoo |logo = Giza Zoo logo.png |logo_caption = Giza Zoo logo |logo_width =200px |image = |image_caption = |location = [[Giza]], [[Egypt]] |date_opened = 1891<ref name="redorbit"/> |date_closed = |coordinates = {{Coord|30|1|28.32|N|31|12|50.03|E|region:EG|display=inline,title}} |area = {{Convert|80|acre|ha|}}<ref name="Giza Zoo Superficy"/> |num_species = 175<ref name="redorbit"/> |num_animals = 6,000<ref name="redorbit"/> |largest_tank_vol = |total_tank_vol = |annual_visitors = 3.4 million (2007)<ref name="zoo_history"/> |members = [[African Association of Zoos and Aquaria|PAAZAB]]<ref name="zoo_main"/> |exhibits = |website = {{URL|http://www.gizazoo-eg.com}} }}
The '''Giza Zoo''' is a [[zoo|zoological garden]] in [[Giza]], [[Egypt]]. It is one of the few green areas in the city, and includes Giza's largest park. The zoo covers about {{Convert|80|acre|ha|}},<ref name="Giza Zoo Superficy"/> and is home to many [[endangered species]], as well as a selection of [[endemism|endemic]] fauna.
Rare species have been successfully bred in the zoo - including the first [[California sea lion]] to be born in the [[Middle East]] in 2002.
==History== [[File:Japanese Building.jpg|thumb|left|Japanese building at the zoo]]
The zoo was built by [[Khedive Ismail]] and opened on 1 March 1891. It was built on about 50 [[feddan]] ({{Convert|21|ha|acre}}) that was once part of the harem gardens. Ismail imported many plants from India, Africa, and South America, of which a banyan tree planted about 1871 can still be seen. The original 180 birds and 78 other animals in the zoo's collection were taken from Ismail's private menagerie.<ref name="egy"/>
In the late 1870s the state took over the zoo as partial payment of the Ismail's debts. In January 1890, the harem building was opened as a natural history museum, and was used in this manner until a new museum was opened in Tahrir Square in 1902. The portion of the gardens facing the Nile were sold to the public for large homes, but the harem gardens were kept intact.<ref name="egy"/>
When the zoo was built, the exhibits with semi-natural habitats were considered spacious by European standards. The animal collection emphasized Egyptian species, and at one time claimed 20,000 individuals representing 400 species, though many of these may have been migratory birds. By the mid-twentieth century, the zoo was considered one of the best zoos in the world, but it has had trouble adapting to the pressures of growth in the latter half of the century as human populations in Cairo have increased.<ref name="animalpeoplenews"/>
By the end of [[World War II]] the zoo claimed 4,700 exhibits, with a total of 700 mammals and 500 reptiles. Attendance levels of 43,567 in 1889 rose to 223,525 by 1906.<ref name="egy"/> In 2007, the zoo hosted almost 3.4 million visitors.<ref name="zoo_history"/>
In 2004, the zoo lost its membership with the [[World Association of Zoos and Aquariums]] (WAZA).<ref name="redorbit"/> The zoo did not pay membership fees, and then ignored the recommendations of WAZA inspectors.<ref name="reuters_2008-10"/> As of 2010, it is a member of the [[African Association of Zoos and Aquaria]] (PAAZAB),<ref name="zoo_main"/> and is working towards getting re-accredited by WAZA.
[[File:Bridge Giza Zoo.jpg|thumb|right|Bridge by Gustave Eiffel at the zoo]]
==Animals in the zoo==
===Mammals=== Mammals at the zoo include giraffes, Rhinoceros, Black bears, Raccoons, Elephant, Sea lions, Tigers, Lions, Cheetahs, zebras, agouti, Red Fox, Dorcas gazelle, Scimitar horned oryx, and many more. ===Birds=== The Giza Zoo has lot of different species of birds like flamingos, falcons, vultures, ibis, love birds, and macaws. ===Reptiles=== The zoo has many species of reptiles that belong to Egypt like the Egyptian cobra and tortoise.It also has Nile Crocodiles and American Alligators.
==Facilities==
The gardens include roads paved with black stone flags from Trieste, footpaths decorated with plebbles laid out like mosaics, and a pond with a marble island that is now the zoo's Tea Island.<ref name="egy"/>
The zoo also includes a suspension bridge designed by [[Gustave Eiffel]] that lets visitors view the animals from above. This bridge may have been the first elevated viewing area at any zoo in the world.<ref name="animalpeoplenews"/>
There is a reptile house and taxidermist's building on site.
==The future==
As part of the upgrades to help the zoo recover its membership in WAZA, in 2008 the bear exhibit was outfitted with fans and misters to help cool the bears. There are plans to run chilled water through the floors to make the bears more comfortable.<ref name="reuters_2008-10"/> {{Clear}}
==See also== {{Portal|Zoos and Aquariums}} * [[Alexandria Zoo]]
==Notes== {{Reflist |refs=
<ref name="zoo_main"> {{Cite web |url=http://www.gizazoo-eg.com |title=Giza Zoo |work=gizazoo-eg.com |publisher=Giza Zoo |accessdate=18 September 2010 }} </ref>
<ref name="zoo_history"> {{Cite web |url=http://www.gizazoo-eg.com/Content/ContentPage.aspx?pageId=2 |title=History |work=gizazoo-eg.com |publisher=Giza Zoo |accessdate=18 September 2010 }} </ref>
<ref name="animalpeoplenews"> {{Cite web |url=http://www.animalpeoplenews.org/08/3/couldthegizazoo0308.htm |title=Could the Giza Zoo become a rescue center? |work=animalpeoplenews.org |publisher=Animal People News |accessdate=18 September 2010 }} </ref>
<ref name="redorbit"> {{Cite web |url=http://www.redorbit.com/news/science/1517301/changes_underway_at_giza_zoo/index.html |title=Changes Underway At Giza Zoo |work=redorbit.com |publisher=redOrbit |accessdate=18 September 2010 }} </ref>
<ref name="egy">{{Cite web|url=http://www.egy.com/giza/97-06-12.shtml |title=THE CAIRO ZOO |work=egy.com |publisher=Egy.com |accessdate=18 September 2010 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091004192742/http://www.egy.com/giza/97-06-12.shtml |archivedate=4 October 2009 }} </ref>
<ref name="Giza Zoo Superficy"> {{Cite web |url=http://www.gizazoo-eg.com/Content/ContentPage.aspx?pageId=2 |title=Giza Zoo > History |work=Giza Zoo |publisher=Giza Zoo |year=2009 |accessdate=5 March 2011 }} </ref>
<ref name="reuters_2008-10"> {{Cite web |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/idUSL155859020080810 |title=Bears chill out as Cairo zoo reforms |last=Johnston |first=Cynthia |work=reuters.com |publisher=Reuters |date=10 August 2008 |accessdate=19 September 2010 }} </ref>
}}

Construction by [[Jean-François Mertens]] and Zamir implementing with [[John Harsanyi]]'s proposal to model games with incomplete information by supposing that each player is characterized by a privately known type that describes his feasible strategies and payoffs as well as a probability distribution over other players' types.<ref name="mertens">{{cite journal | author=Jean -François Mertens and Shmuel Zamir| title=Formulation of Bayesian analysis for games with incomplete information| journal=INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL OF GAME THEORY| date=1985-03-01| volume=14| issue=1| pages=1–29| doi=10.1007/BF01770224}}</ref>
Such probability distribution at the first level can be interpreted as a low level belief of a player. One level up the probability on the belief of other players is interpreted as beliefs on beliefs. A recursive universal construct is built—in which player have beliefs on their beliefs at different level—this construct is called the hierarchy of beliefs.
The result is a universal space of types in which, subject to specified consistency conditions, each type corresponds to the infinite hierarchy of his probabilistic beliefs about others' probabilistic beliefs. They also showed that any subspace can be approximated arbitrarily closely by a finite subspace.
Another popular example of the usage of the construction is the [[Prisoners and hats puzzle]]. And so is [[Robert Aumann]]'s construction of [[Common knowledge (logic)|common knowledge]].<ref name="Gintis2009">{{cite book|author=Herbert Gintis|title=The bounds of reason: game theory and the unification of the behavioral sciences|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=an9MXLCYgw8C&pg=PA158|accessdate=3 March 2012|date=16 March 2009|publisher=Princeton University Press|isbn=978-0-691-14052-0|page=158}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
{{game theory}}
[[Category:Game theory]]

'''Jon Mostad''' (born 21 April 1942) is a composer from [[Fredrikstad]], [[Norway]]. He received the Norwegian state three-year scholarship for artists from 1982 until 1984.
==Musical style== In his early compositions Mostad is moving from a linear-expressionist style to a more timbre-oriented line of thinking where both modernist and romantic music are inspiring his work. From around 1975 the timbre/harmonic aspect of his music becomes more related to the harmonic series. During the 80s and 90s he combines this with other types of modal and free compositional techniques, sometimes utilising modal techniques as well as more overtone-oriented harmonic spectra within the same composition.
At the same time he has also been experimenting with untraditional structuring of his material, both in works of one movement and in cyclical works. Many of Mostad's instrumental works as well as vocal music, are inspired by Judæo-Christian texts which often influence the structuring of the music. For instance in "And the light shines in darkness" a massive dark sounding layer with lots of rhythmical unrest gradually gets introduced to a lighter sounding chord with notes from the harmonic series.
Mostad has written chamber music, solo pieces for piano, guitar, organ and utilised electronics, both pre-recorded and live with interaction with live musicians, but his main focus has been orchestral and vocal music. His longest composition is the work "[[Were you there, when they crucified my Lord?]]" for choir, recitation, solo voices and orchestra.
==Performances== The music of Jon Mostad has been played by leading orchestras in Norway (Oslo, Bergen, Trondheim...) as well as performed at [[Bergen International Festival]], the Elverum Festival, Music Factory in Bergen and Dartington International Summer School in Totnes, England among other festivals. In 2010 he was featured composer of the Vinteriss festival in [[Østfold]] (a region in Norway). He has been represented at [[Nordic Music Days]] and has been played on radio in the [[Nordic countries]], former Jugoslavia and England. His "2 psalms" for choir has been sung numerous times in Japan, England and Norway.
Mostad's music has also been performed by local amateur ensembles. Music ranging from small chamber pieces to the multimedia show [[Terje Vigen]] based on texts by [[Henrik Ibsen]] and theatrical music for Ibsen's [[Peer Gynt]] were written for local ensembles in [[Fredrikstad]].
Mostad has also got commissions from Ny Musikk, [[NRK]] radio and TV, Ungdomssymfonikerne, Det Norske Blåseensemble, Amsterdams Gitaartrio and Oslo Sinfonietta as well as from local ensembles in Fredrikstad.
Mostad plays the piano, but has seldom been involved in performing his own music. Occasionally he has improvised pre- and postludes when susbtituting as organist in local churches and from time to time he has also played some of his smaller works for piano (with or without electronics) live at concerts. During the 2010 Vinterriss festival he was playing the live electronics part at the premiere of his piece "Ikke helt solo" ("not quite solo") for cello and quadrophonic live electronics.
==Recordings== The music of Jon Mostad has been recorded by [[The norwegian Soloist's choir]], The [[Oslo Philharmonic]], [[Øystein Birkeland]] and [[Bergen Philharmonic Orchestra]]. His orchestral works "House", "The light shines in darkness" and "Concerto for cello and orchestra" were chosen by a jury of the [[Norwegian Society of Composers]] to be recorded on the Aurora label, resulting in the CD "The light shines in darkness" with [[Oslo Philharmonic]], cellist [[Øystein Birkeland]] and conductor [[Michel Swierczewski]].
==Education== Theological candidate 1965. Music and pedagogy 1969. Diploma in composition at the [[Norwegian Academy of Music]] (ending in 1974). Main teacher: [[Finn Mortensen]]. An important inspiration during his studies were the private seminars in sonology and on Mahler by [[Olav Anton Thommessen]]. Shorter courses in studio work at NSEM, Høvikodden (1975/76), EMS [[Stockholm]] (1983).
==Other activities== In addition to composing, Jon Mostad was teaching arrangement and composition, music and religion at high schools in [[Fredrikstad]] and [[Moss]] (years 10-12 or 11-13 in the Norwegian school system) until he retired in 2006. Among his many students were film director [[Harald Zwart]] and composer [[Frank Tveor Nordensten]].
He has also been active in organisations such as Ny Musikk Østfold, the regional branch of an organisation promoting contemporary music, [[Norwegian Society of Composers]] and [[TONO]].
Mostad is a devout Lutheran and has done volunteer work in Christian organisations such as being a Sunday school teacher, visiting prisoners, helping find funding and equipment for a hospital in Nigeria and delivering humanitarian aid to a village in Russia shortly after the fall of the Soviet bloc.
== External links == * [http://www.jonmostad.no/ Jon Mostad's official homepage] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20110610222058/http://www.mic.no/mic.nsf/doc/art2002100810185392183108 Jon Mostad biography - Norwegian Music Information Centre] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20110720074922/http://www.listento.no/mic.nsf/doc/art2006112410484337582970 UK premiere of "The Lord is my sheppard" from "2 psalms"] * [http://www.komponist.musiconline.no/shop/displayComposerTracks.asp?kid=34687&kname=JON%20MOSTAD Discography from Musikkonline & Norwegian Society of Composers]{{dead link|date=April 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} * [https://web.archive.org/web/20110720074934/http://www.listento.no/mic.nsf/doc/art2004031810320668805218 Recording of Mostad's "2 psalms" with The Norwegian Soloist's choir]
{{Portal|Arts}}

{{Use dmy dates|date=January 2018}} {{Use British English|date=January 2018}} {{Infobox newspaper | name = {{noitalic|{{nobold|კომუნისტი}}}}
Komunisti | logo = KomunistiLogo.svg | image = DeathofStalinGeorgia.jpg | caption = The front page of ''Kommunisti'' on the death of Stalin. | type = Daily newspaper | format = [[Broadsheet]] | foundation = {{Start date and age|1920|06|3|df=yes}} (as Georgian Communist)
{{Start date and age|1921|03|2|df=yes}} (as Communist) | ceased publication = 1990, replaced by New Georgia newspaper | price = | owners =[[Communist Party of Georgia (Soviet Union)|Communist Party of Georgia]] | editor = N. Kiknadze (1923–1935)
K. Sherozia (1937)
F. Khatiashvili (1938–1944)
B.Nanitashvili (1944-) | chiefeditor = | assoceditor = | staff = | language = [[Georgian language|Georgian]] | political = [[Communism]]
[[Marxism–Leninism]] | circulation = 700,000 (1980) | headquarters = | ISSN = | website = }} '''''Komunisti''''' (in {{lang-en|'''Communist'''}}), ({{lang-ka|კომუნისტი|tr}}, {{IPA-ka|kʼɔmunistʼi}}) was a daily newspaper published by the Georgian Communist Party Central Committee. The first number was issued on June 3, 1920 in [[Tbilisi]] as the daily organ of the Communist Party of Georgia and the Central Committee of the Communist Party, named "New Communist".{{cite web | url = http://www.nplg.gov.ge/paperge/ka/browse/000814/set/ | title = Entry of New Communist in Georgia's newspaper center | author = | date = | work = | publisher = | accessdate = 25 April 2018 }} After the publication of 10 numbers, the newspaper was closed down by the General-Governor of Tbilisi. During the [[Democratic Republic of Georgia|first government of independent Georgia]] the newspaper was named "Georgia Communist". After the [[Red Army invasion of Georgia|establishment of the Soviet government in Georgia]] on March 2, 1921, it was renamed ''Komunisti''.{{cite web | url = http://www.nplg.gov.ge/paperge/ka/browse/000001/set/ | title = Entry of Kommunisti in Georgia's newspaper center | author = | date = | work = | publisher = | accessdate = 25 April 2018 }}{{cite web | url = https://lccn.loc.gov/sn92068070 | title = Komunisti : Sakʻartʻvelos K.P. centraluri komitetis | author = | date = | work = | publisher = | accessdate = 25 April 2018 }} ''Komunisti'' reflected all the important periods of the history of the Georgian SSR, supporting the CPSU and the Government's decisions. The newspaper covered topics about policy, economics, industry, agriculture, literature, arts, education and other issues. The newspaper had its additions – journals ''Torch'' (1923–1925), ''Science and Technology'' (1925–1926), ''Flag'' (1929–1934), and ''Agriculture'' (1958).{{cite book | last = Mchedlishvili | first = D. | date = 1980 | title = ქართული საბჭოთა ენციკლოპედია | trans-title = Georgian Soviet Encyclopedia | url = | language = Georgian | location = | publisher = | isbn = }} ''Komunisti'' was awarded the [[Order of Red Banner]] of the 1950s. The newspaper ceased to exist after the dissolution of the USSR and the restoration of Georgian independence. == References == {{reflist}} {{Eastern Bloc media}} [[Category:Communist newspapers]] [[Category:Eastern Bloc media]] [[Category:Newspapers published in the Soviet Union]] [[Category:Newspapers published in Georgia (country)]] [[Category:Publications established in 1920]] [[Category:Publications of the Communist Party of the Soviet Union]]

page.title: Korean television dramas in the Philippines

revision.text:
{{Multiple issues|{{cleanup list|date=August 2015}} {{POV|date=August 2015}} {{primary sources|date=May 2015}} {{more citations needed|date=February 2017}}}} [[Korean drama]]s started broadcasting in the [[Philippines]] since 2003, beginning with [[GMA Network]] airing ''[[Successful Story of a Bright Girl|Bright Girl]]''.
Most media broadcasters in the Philippines airing Korean dramas are ABS-CBN, GMA and The 5 Network, as well as minor TV network [[Net 25]] and government channel [[People's Television Network|PTV]], among others. All Korean dramas go through the process of localization: re-dubbing, pre-editing, post-editing and finalization before going on-air.
==History== Korean dramas began airing in the Philippines in 2003, with shows such as ''[[Successful Story of a Bright Girl|Bright Girl]]'', ''[[Autumn in My Heart]]'', ''[[Lovers in Paris]]'' and ''[[My Girl (2005 TV series)|My Girl]]''.
===Popularity=== <!-- Please stop added ''Anti-Anime'' Sentiments on this Korean television dramas in the Philippines article --> Korean dramas have become hits since the 2000s, excluding Japanese dramas. The huge demand from viewers for Korean dramas has prompted Philippine TV stations to import Korean, Taiwanese and Chinese dramas only. Top Korean drama series ''[[Lovers in Paris]]'', ''[[Full House (South Korean TV series)|Full House]]'', ''[[My Lovely Sam Soon|My Name Is Kim Sam Soon]]'', ''[[Stairway to Heaven (2003 TV series)|Stairway to Heaven]]'' and ''[[The 1st Shop of Coffee Prince|Coffee Prince]]'' were imported and dubbed in Filipino language, instantly becoming hits. The success of ''[[Dae Jang Geum|Jewel in the Palace]]'' in Korea was also replicated in the Philippines and many other Asian countries.
The Taiwanese drama ''[[Meteor Garden]]'' was also a ratings success when it first aired on ABS-CBN in 2003. Its remake, the Korean ''[[Boys Over Flowers (TV series)|Boys Over Flowers]]'', starring [[Lee Min-ho (actor born 1987)|Lee Min Ho]], [[Kim Hyun-joong|Kim Hyun Joong]], [[Kim Bum]], [[Kim Joon]], [[Kim So-eun|Kim So Eun]] and [[Ku Hye-sun|Koo Hye Sun]], also succeeded in capturing audiences. It was aired in the Philippines from May to August 2009 and became a phenomenal success.
The 5 Network, the third largest network in the country, aired Korean dramas such as ''[[Hero (2009 TV series)|Hero]]'' and ''[[Queen of Housewives|My Wife is a Superwoman]]'', together with the Taiwanese drama ''Easy Fortune Happy Life'', Israeli drama ''[[Split (TV series)|Split]]'', and primetime variety show ''[[Wil Time Bigtime|Willing Willie]]'' hosted by [[Willie Revillame]].<ref>[http://www.pep.ph/guide/tv/6170/tv5-brings-top-hit-my-wife-is-a-superwoman-and-two-more-asian-drama-titles-on-primetime, TV5 brings top hit My Wife is a Superwoman and two more Asian drama titles on primetime]</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.pep.ph/guide/tv/6367/international-hit-vampire-series-invades-the-philippines|title=International hit vampire series invades the Philippines|publisher=}}</ref> However, a The 5 Network representative said that instead of putting all their own Korean dramas in primetime, they've decided to move it on noontime: "''It's actually the strategy of TV5 to do counter-programming. When everyone else is going high-energy with noontime shows, here we are offering the best titles of Koreanovelas on noontime. It's like it will be our primetime. We want to provide an alternative.''"<ref>[http://www.pep.ph/guide/tv/5744/tv5s-koreanovelas-offer-alternative-to-noontime-shows, TV5's koreanovelas offer alternative to noontime shows]</ref>
In the past years, ABS-CBN has aired a score of Korean dramas, including ''[[Marrying a Millionaire]]'', ''[[The 101st Proposal|101st Proposal]]'', ''[[Green Rose]]'', ''[[Boys Over Flowers (TV series)|Boys Over Flowers]]'', ''[[Lovers in Paris]]'', ''[[You're Beautiful|He's Beautiful]]'', ''[[Heartstrings (TV series)|Heartstings]]'', ''[[City Hunter (TV series)|City Hunter]]'', ''[[Something Happened in Bali|Memories of Bali]]'', ''[[Rooftop Prince]]'', ''[[Missing You (2013 TV series)|Missing You]]'', ''[[Princess Hours]]'', ''[[My Girlfriend is a Nine-Tailed Fox|My Girlfriend is a Gumiho]]'', ''[[Dream High]]'', ''[[My Girl (2005 TV series)|My Girl]]'', ''[[Fated to Love You (2014 TV series)|Fated to Love You]]'', ''[[My Lovely Girl]]'', ''[[When a Man Falls in Love]]'', ''[[That Winter, the Wind Blows]]'', ''[[The Heirs]]'', ''[[Hwarang: The Poet Warrior Youth|Hwarang]]'', ''[[Love in the Moonlight]]'', ''[[The Legend of the Blue Sea|Legend of the Blue Sea]]'', ''[[Guardian: The Lonely and Great God|Goblin]]'', ''[[Black (TV series)|Black]]'', ''[[A Korean Odyssey|Hwayugi]]'', and many more.<ref>https://www.koreatimes.co.kr/www/news/nation/2010/09/117_51344.html, Korean Dramas Continue to Captivate the Philippines</ref>
GMA Network, for its part, has aired a number of Korean dramas, including ''[[Full House (2004 TV series)|Full House]]'', ''[[All About Eve (TV series)|All About Eve]]'', ''[[My Lovely Sam Soon|My Name Is Kim Sam Soon]]'', ''[[Stairway to Heaven (2003 TV series)|Stairway to Heaven]]'', ''[[Dae Jang Geum|Jewel in the Palace]]'', ''[[Autumn in My Heart]]'', ''[[Winter Sonata]]'', ''[[Brilliant Legacy|Shining Inheritance]]'', ''[[Temptation of Wife (2008 TV series)|Temptation of Wife]]'', ''[[East of Eden (TV series)|East of Eden]]'', ''[[Queen Seondeok (TV series)|Queen Seon Deok]]'', ''[[Master's Sun]]'', ''[[Queen In-hyun's Man]]'', ''[[The Princess' Man]]'', ''[[Dong Yi (TV series)|Dong Yi]]'', ''[[Empress Ki (TV series)|Empress Ki]]'', ''[[My Love from the Star]]'', ''[[Descendants of the Sun]]'', and among others.
The 5 Network has also aired ''[[Hero (2009 TV series)|Hero]]'', ''[[Queen of Housewives|My Wife is a Superwoman]]'', ''[[I Love You, Don't Cry|Don't Cry My Love]]'', ''[[First Wives' Club]]'', ''[[High Kick!]]'', ''[[High Kick! (season 2)|High Kick: Through the Roof]]'', ''[[High Kick: Revenge of the Short Legged]]'', ''[[Likeable or Not]]'', ''[[Get Karl! Oh Soo-jung|Oh Soo Jung vs Karl]]'', ''[[Pink Lipstick]]'', ''[[The Fugitive: Plan B|Runaway]]'', ''[[Smile, You|Smile, Honey]]'' and ''[[You Are My Destiny (TV series)|You Are My Destiny]]''.
As of 2014, the [[Government of the Philippines|Philippine government]] channel [[People's Television Network|PTV]] had began airing Korean dramas starting with ''[[Here Comes Mr. Oh|Oh Ja Ryong is Coming]]''.

page.title: List of professional wrestling promotions in Japan

revision.text:
{{about|[[professional wrestling promotion]]s in [[Japan]]|an international listing|List of professional wrestling promotions}} This is a '''list of professional wrestling promotions in Japan''' which includes both national and independent [[puroresu]] and [[Puroresu#Female wrestling|joshi]] companies from the [[post-World War II|post-World War II period]] up to the present day. ==Major promotions== ===Puroresu=== {| class="wikitable sortable" !
